span.style: font-size: 14.4px; line-height: 21.6px; text-align: left; font-family: inherit;

br.br:
Click the link to take you to our digital learning platform
Slaton Tigers Digital Learning

strong.span: Attention Slaton ISD families. As we move closer to the end of school we want to make you aware of the process for checking in devices.
iPads and Chromebooks are due back to the district by Friday, May 15th. You will have two opportunities to return these devices:

em.span: Thursday, May 14th 9:00am to 3:00pm Drop Off Location: Slaton Junior High-Front (West Jean Street)
Friday, May 15th 9:00am to 3:00pm Drop Off Location: Slaton Junior High-Front (West Jean Street)

strong.span: Parents/guardians please remain in your vehicle when checking in your iPad/Chromebook.
Please make sure all vehicles remain in a single file line.
Our friendly staff will greet you at your vehicle to retrieve and inspect the device.
At this time they will also provide you with paper packets so that your students can continue instruction through the last day of the 2019-2020 school year (May 20th).

span.style: font-size: 14.4px; line-height: 21.6px; text-align: left; font-family: inherit;

br.br: The Slaton Independent School District Board of Trustees has named Jim Andrus as the Lone Finalist for the Superintendent’s position at SISD. By state statute, the Board must now wait 21 days before action can be taken to employ Mr. Andrus. Jim has been the assistant superintendent in charge of instruction at SISD since 2018. He also served as principal of Slaton Junior High, and he served as assistant principal at Cavazos Middle School, principal of Preston Smith Elementary, assistant principal at JT Hutchinson Junior High and director of secondary program for advancement, all in Lubbock. Jim was raised in Roswell, New Mexico and received his Bachelor’s degree from Eastern New Mexico University in 1984 and his Master’s degree from Wayland Baptist University in 2001. He received his Superintendent’s certification from Texas Tech in 2014. Jim’s wife, Lori, is a retired school administrator and currently works for Southwest Airlines as a flight attendant.

span.br: Slaton ISD standard grading protocols remains in effect during the COVID-19 school suspension with the following adjustments:

li.span: 1st Semester Grades (9 weeks 1&2) remain.
3rd 9 weeks grading period was complete on March 13, 2020.Passing 3rd 9 weeks grades remain.
4th 9 weeks grades will mirror passing 3rd 9 weeks grades and result in the 2nd Semester Credit

A student in grades 9–12, or in a lower grade when a student is enrolled in a high school credit-bearing course, will earn credit for a course only if the final grade is 70 or above. For a two-semester (1 credit) course, the student’s grades from both semesters will be averaged and credit will be awarded if the combined average is 70 or above. Should the student’s combined average be less than 70, the student will be required to retake the semester in which he or she failed. Retaking the failed courses will consist of either repeating the class or online credit recovery which will be determined by the counselor or principal.
Student did not earn a passing grade for the 3rd 9 weeks:

If that grade was 55 or above, they will have an opportunity to complete a mastery packet that exhibits foundational mastery over failed concepts.If successfully completed the student will receive a 70 for the 3rd and 4th 9 weeks.
If that grade was below a 54 or lower, they will receive a failing grade for the 3rd and 4th 9 weeks and not receive credit for that semester.
Elementary and Junior High students will have a grade placement meeting with the Parent, classroom Teacher(s) and campus Principal.

strong.span: For student taking Dual Credit courses:

li.span: Grading policies remain in effect and 2nd semester grades will be determined at the end of the 4th 9 weeks.

p.span: There are a lot of things that have changed in our routines over the past weeks. Hopefully this grading protocol will give you assurance that tigers are receiving credit for their work. If you have any question regarding your student’s grade(s), please contact your campus principal for a more complete explanation of how your child’s grade may be affected.

div.div: Schools closed for the rest of this school year

p.span: Due to COVID-19, the Governor of Texas has extended the closure of all schools in the state through the REMAINDER OF THE SCHOOL YEAR in an effort to support our nation’s need to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19.
Slaton ISD will continue to distribute sack meals each week Monday thru Friday until Wednesday, May 20, 2020.
All school owned technology will be due back to the school by Friday, May 15, 2020. Additional information will be communicated as soon as plans are finalized.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to continue social distancing protocol. We want to reiterate a request to our broader community to take the following reasonable precautions to prevent the spread of the illness:

li.span: Don’t shake hands
Wash your hands regularly
Limit movement within the community, especially avoiding crowded places and maintain 6 ft of distance between people (at least two arm’s lengths)
If you are moving around in the community, don’t congregate in large groups
For those who have traveled to areas with known COVID-19 cases – both inside and outside of the country – it is recommended that you self-quarantine and monitor for symptoms.
If you suspect you have

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 99, 193);
text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(5, 99, 193);

li.span: of COVID-19, call your health care provider for medical advice .
Stay at home if you feel ill, even if you think it is just a cold.
Do not leave the house if you are ill, except to access medical care

p.span: Thank you for your support and cooperation as we ensure that all members of the community in Slaton Independent School District stay safe and healthy.

span.style: font-size: 14.4px; line-height: 21.6px; text-align: left; font-family: inherit;

span.strong: The mission of Slaton ISD is to inspire and empower all students to lead extraordinary lives and embrace the possibilities of the 21st century through relevant, engaging learning experiences led by inspirational and nurturing educators.
